Description: Texoma Community Center discloses a phishing attack affecting more than affected more than 24,000 people.
Researchers from Akamai discover Capoae, a new strain of malware, written in Go, used in cyberattacks launched against WordPress and Linux systems.

Author: Nigerian Threat Actor
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of Operation Layover, a campaign active since at leas 2013 and targeting the aviation industry for at least two years.

Target: Government departments in at least 7 countries in the APAC and EMEA regions.
Description: Researchers from Cyjax reveal the details of a phishing campaign targeting the government departments in at least 7 countries in the Asia-Pacific (APAC) and Europe, the Middle East and Africa (EMEA) regions.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: AristoK3
Description: SushiSwap, a community-driven decentralized finance (DeFi) is hit by $3 million supply chain attack.

Author: Multiple threat actors (including the Mirai botnet)
Description: Threat actors start actively exploiting the critical Azure OMIGOD vulnerabilities two days after Microsoft disclosed them during this month's Patch Tuesday.

Author: Numando
Target: Bank customers in Brazil, Mexico, and Spain
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of Numando, a banking Trojan active in Brazil, Mexico, and Spain.
Horizon House warns that 27,823 people might have been impacted by a ransomware attack that took place in March.
City of Mount Vernon suffers a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: A ransomware attack is said to have encrypted certain sensitive documents of the Tamil Nadu Public Department.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Exabytes reveals that it has experienced a ransomware attack.
Decentralized Finance platform pNetwork suffers the theft of 277 BTC ($12M worth).
A new Elon Musk-themed cryptocurrency giveaway scam called the "Elon Musk Mutual Aid Fund" or "Elon Musk Club" is being promoted through spam email campaigns that started over the past few weeks.
Tags: Elon Musk, Elon Musk Mutual Aid Fund, Elon Musk Club, crypto

Author: Italian Mafia
Description: The Spanish National Police (Policía Nacional) and the Italian National Police (Polizia di Stato), in collaboration with Europol and Eurojust, dismantle an extensive network of cybercriminals linked to the Italian Mafia that was able to defraud their victims of roughly €10 million ($11.7 million) only in 2020.
Tags: Spanish National Police, Policía Nacional, Italian National Police, Polizia di Stato, Europol, Eurojust, Italian Mafia

Description: CMA CGM is hit by another cyber attack, just under one year since its last big breach. The French containerline tells customers that it had suffered a leak of data on limited customer information involving first and last names, employer, position, email address and phone number.

Author: BlackMatter
Description: U.S. farmers cooperative NEW Cooperative suffers a BlackMatter ransomware attack demanding $5.9 million not to leak stolen data and provide a decryptor.

Author: BlackMatter
Description: The BlackMatter ransomware gang hits Marketron, a business software solutions provider that serves more than 6,000 customers in the media industry.
Researchers from Microsoft reveal the details of BulletProofLink (also known as BulletProftLink and Anthrax), a large scale phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) operation.
Tags: Microsoft, BulletProofLink,  BulletProftLink, Anthrax, phishing-as-a-service, PhaaS

Description: Threat actors are compromising Windows IIS servers to add expired certificate notification pages that prompt visitors to download a malicious fake installer of  TVRAT (aka TVSPY, TeamSpy, TeamViewerENT, or Team Viewer RAT),
Tags: Windows IIS, TVRAT, TVSPY, TeamSpy, TeamViewerENT Team Viewer RAT

Description: Multiple Russian government websites including the elections and state services portals are hit with a DDoS attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: McAllen Surgical Specialty Center discloses a ransomware attack. The data of 29,000 patients is potentially compromised.
Family Medical Center of Michigan (FMC) begins notifying patients that their financial information was exposed during a ransomware attack. The data of 20,000 individuals is compromised.
Tags: Family Medical Center of Michigan, FMC, ransomware

Author: ALTDOS
Description: ALTDOS claims to have hacked Sunway Group one of Malaysia’s biggest conglomerates

Author: FocaLeaks
Target: Policía Nacional Civil de El Salvador (PNC)
Description: Hacktivists known as FocaLeaks claim to have hacked and exfiltrated data on 37,000 agents of Policía Nacional Civil de El Salvador (PNC).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Policía Nacional Civil de El Salvador, PNC, FocaLeaks

Description: Carmel Clay Schools discovers suspicious activity involving employee email accounts and notifies 15,817 individuals.

Author: Turla
Target: Organizations in the U.S., Germany, and Afghanistan
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of TinyTurla, a previously undocumented backdoor used to target organizations in the U.S., Germany, and Afghanistan.

Author: TAG-28
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group reveal that TAG-28, a China-linked group launched a cyber attack against India's largest media conglomerate, the Bennett Coleman And Co Ltd.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, TAG-28, Bennett Coleman And Co Ltd., BCCL

Author: TAG-28
Description: During the same operation, the Chinese attackers also hit the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) database, which contains a motherlode of biometric information.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, TAG-28, Unique Identification Authority of India, UIDAI

Author: z0Miner
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover z0Miner, a new cryptojacker weaponizing the new CVE-2021-26084 Confluence vulnerability to mine for cryptocurrency on vulnerable machines.

Author: Emissary Panda (AKA APT27)?
Description: Researchers of eSentire reveal the details of an unusual ransomware attack mimicking the modus operandi of a state-sponsored operation.

Author: Cring
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal the details of a Cring ransomware attack where the attackers exploited two old Adobe ColdFusion vulnerabilities (CVE-2010-2861 and CVE-2009-3960).
Tags: Sophos, Cring,  ransomware, Adobe ColdFusion, CVE-2010-2861, CVE-2009-3960

Author: Jupyter
Description: Researchers from Morphisec reveal the details of a new version of the Jupyter infostealer.

Simon Eye Management, a US chain of optometry clinics, reports a data breach potentially impacting more than 144,000 individuals, after unauthorized access to employee email accounts over a seven-day period between May 12-18, 2021.
Pottawatomie County suffers a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Minnesota farming supply cooperative Crystal Valley suffers a ransomware attack.

Author: Conti
Description: CISA, the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), and the National Security Agency (NSA) warn of an increased number of Conti ransomware attacks targeting US organizations.
Tags: CISA, Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, National Security Agency, NSA, Conti, ransomware

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors have already started targeting Internet-exposed VMware vCenter servers unpatched against CVE-2021-22005.

Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign targeting JSC Makeyev Design Bureau, a known developer of liquid and solid fuel for Russia’s ballistic missiles and space rocket, via the recently discovered MSHTML Microsoft CVE-2021-40444 vulnerability.
Tags: Malwarebytes, JSC Makeyev Design Bureau, Microsoft, MSHTML, CVE-2021-40444

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign targeting the Russian Interior Ministry, via the recently discovered MSHTML Microsoft CVE-2021-40444 vulnerability.
Tags: Malwarebytes, Russian Interior Ministry, Microsoft, MSHTML, CVE-2021-40444

Description: Debt-IN Consultants (Pty) Ltd, announces that a ransomware attack by cyber criminals has resulted in a significant data breach of consumer and employee personal information. More than 1.4 million South Africans are suspected to have been impacted.

USV Optical, Inc., a subsidiary of U.S. Vision, Inc., discloses that data belonging to 180,000 individuals (employees and patients) might have been accessed and possibly exfiltrated by an unauthorized individual from April 20, 2021, to May 17, 2021.

Author: FamousSparrow
Description: Researchers from ESET reveal the details of FamousSparrow, a newly discovered cyberespionage group using the ProxyLogon exploit to target hotels worldwide, as well as higher-profile targets such as governments, international organizations, law firms, and engineering companies.
Threat actors hijack Bitcoin.org, the authentic website of the Bitcoin project, and alter its parts to push a cryptocurrency giveaway scam.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Apple releases security updates to fix CVE-2021-30869, a zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild by attackers to hack into iPhones and Macs.

Author: OpenSUpdater
Description: Google researchers discover a malware campaign exploiting malformed code signatures seen as valid in Windows to bypass security software. The tactic is actively used to push OpenSUpdater, a family of unwanted software that injects ads and installs unwanted programs onto the victims' devices.

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: Cybercriminals are slowly realizing that the REvil ransomware operators may have been hijacking ransom negotiations, to cut affiliates out of payments.

A suspected state-sponsored hacking group has attempted to breach the network of the Port of Houston, one of the largest port authorities in the US, using the CVE-2021-40539 zero-day vulnerability in Zoho.

Author: ZLoader
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover a new ZLoader campaign with a shift in delivery method: from the traditional email campaigns to the abuse of online ad platforms.

Author: APT36 (aka Mythic Leopard and Transparent Tribe)?
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of "Operation Armor Piercer”, a series of malicious attacks targeting Indian government and military personnel using commercial remote access Trojans (RATs) such as Netwire and Warzone (AKA AveMaria).
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Cisco Talos, Operation Armor Piercer, Netwire, Warzone, AveMaria

Author: TangleBot
Target: Android mobile users in the United States and Canada
Description: Researchers from Cloudmark discover TangleBot, a new piece of mobile malware spreading via SMS and currently targeting Android mobile users in the United States and Canada
Spanish authorities warn of a phishing campaign that impersonates messaging service WhatsApp in an attempt to trick recipients into downloading the NoPiques trojan.

Author: Ghostwriter
Target: High-profile EU officials, journalists, and the general public.
Description: The European Union officially links Russia to a hacking operation known as Ghostwriter that targets high-profile EU officials, journalists, and the general public.

Author: Vice Society
Description: ​California-based United Health Centers suffered a ransomware attack that reportedly disrupted all of their locations and resulted in patient data theft.
MoneyLion locks the customer accounts that were breached in a credential stuffing attacks over the summer.
Crypto exchange Coinbase discloses that a threat actor stole cryptocurrency from 6,000 customers after using a vulnerability to bypass the company's SMS multi-factor authentication security feature.
Google releases Chrome 94.0.4606.61 for Windows, Mac, and Linux, an emergency update addressing CVE-2021-37973, a high-severity zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Author: Conti
Description: GSS, the Spanish and Latin America division of Covisian, one of Europe’s largest customer care and call center providers, is hit by a Conti ransomware attack.

Author: Colossus
Target: Automotive group of dealerships based in the U.S.
Description: Researchers from ZeroFox discover a new ransomware dubbed Colossus, targeting at least an automotive group of dealerships company in the US.
UK umbrella payroll firm Giant Pay is hit by a ransomware attack.
UK Police issues an urgent warning after an elderly man is scammed out of £30,000 by phone fraudsters pretending to be from BT.
Eastern Los Angeles Regional Center notifies to have suffered a phishing attack compromising the data of nearly 13,000 individuals.
Council on Aging of Southwestern (COA) reveals to have suffered a phishing incident.
Tags: Council on Aging of Southwestern, COA

Description: Golden Entertainment discloses a malware incident.
A ransomware attack disrupts the services at Coos County Family Health Services.
Tags: ransomware, Coos County Family Health Services

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Desorden Group claims to have stolen 200 GB of data from ABX Express.
Tesuque Casino is hit with a cyber attack.

Author: RansomEXX
Description: The RansomEXX gang hits the Union of Reno Galliera (a union of eight towns in the metropolitan area of Bologna) and dumps 80Gb online.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: RansomEXX, ransomware, Union of Reno Galliera, Bologna

Description: Syniverse, a company that is a critical part of the global telecommunications infrastructure used by AT&T, T-Mobile, Verizon and several others around the world discloses that hackers were inside its systems for years, impacting more than 200 of its clients and potentially millions of cellphone users worldwide.

Author: APT29 AKA Nobelium, The Dukes, Cozy Bear
Description: Researchers from Microsoft discover FoggyWeb, a new malware used by the Nobelium hacking group to deploy additional payloads and steal sensitive info from Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS) servers.
Tags: Microsoft, FoggyWeb, Active Directory Federation Services, ADFS, APT29, Nobelium, The Dukes, Cozy Bear

Description: Bandwidth.com becomes the latest victim of distributed denial of service attacks targeting VoIP providers.

Author: BloodyStealer
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover BloodyStealer, a new malware sold on dark web forums used by threat actors to steal accounts for multiple gaming platforms, including Steam, Epic Games Store, and EA Origin.
Tags: Kaspersky,  BloodyStealer, Steam, Epic Games Store, EA Origin

Description: A malicious Firefox add-on named "Safepal Wallet" scam users by emptying out their wallets and lived on the Mozilla add-ons store for seven months.
Vista Radiology notifies 3,634 patients about a ransomware attack experienced on July which took part of its network offline.
Robinwood Orthopaedic Specialty Center is hit with a Groove ransomware attack. The attackers claim to have stolen 25,000 customers' cards.
Tags: Robinwood Orthopaedic Specialty Center, Groove,  ransomware

Author: CoomingProject
Target: El Instituto Nacional de Medicina Genómica (Inmegen)
Description: The threat actors from CoomingProject claim to have hit El Instituto Nacional de Medicina Genómica (Inmegen) a Mexican government health agency that is involved in COVID testing or research.
Tags: El Instituto Nacional de Medicina Genómica, Inmegen, COVID, CoomingProject

Description: Allen Independent School District emails parents and staff to inform them about the steps being taken a cybersecurity breach.

Author: Calypso APT
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group detect an intrusion activity targeting a mail server of Roshan, one of Afghanistan’s largest telecommunications providers.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Roshan, Calypso APT

Author: RedFoxtrot
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group detect an additional intrusion activity targeting Roshan.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Roshan, RedFoxtrot

Author: RedFoxtrot
Description: In the same period, researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group detect an additional intrusion activity targeting a second, undisclosed, Afghan telecommunications organization.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Roshan, RedFoxtrot

Description: Researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group detect an additional intrusion activity targeting Roshan carried out via the Winnti backdoor.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Roshan, Winnti

Description: And finally, the same researchers from Recorded Future's Insikt Group detect an additional intrusion activity targeting Roshan carried out via the PlugX backdoor.
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Roshan, PlugX

Description: Researchers from Armorblox discover a credential phishing attack spoofing an encrypted message notification from Zix, a company offering security services.

Author: ERMAC
Description: Researchers from ThreatFabric reveal the details of ERMAC, a new Android banking Trojan that can steal financial data from 378 banking and wallet apps.
Fraudsters are using Twitter bots to trick unsuspecting tweeters into making PayPal and Venmo payments to accounts under their control.
America’s Frontline Doctors, a right-wing group that promotes pro-Trump doctors during the coronavirus pandemic, has some data leaked after an alleged hack.
Lufkin Independent School District is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: APT29 AKA Nobelium, The Dukes, Cozy Bear
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover Tomiris a new backdoor likely developed by the Nobelium hacking group behind last year's SolarWinds supply chain attack.
Tags: Kaspersky, Tomiris, SolarWinds, APT29, Nobelium, The Dukes, Cozy Bear

Author: GriftHorse
Description: Researchers from Zimperium discover GriftHorse, a large-scale malware campaign that has infected more than 10 million Android devices from over 70 countries and likely stole hundreds of millions from its victims by tricking them into subscribing to paid services without their knowledge.

Author: Conti
Description: Researchers from Advanced Intelligence discover a new version of the Conti ransomware able to destroy backups.

Target: PayPal, Apple Pay and Google Pay users
Description: Researchers from Intel 471 discover a campaign stealing one-time password tokens to gain access to PayPal, Apple Pay and Google Pay using Telegram bots and channels
Tags: Intel 471, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Telegram

Author: TA544
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new malware campaign targeting more than 2,000 organizations in Italy with the Ursnif banking trojan.
Schneck Medical Center suffers a cyber attack.

American luxury retailer Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) discloses a major data breach impacting approximately 4.6 million customers. The breach occurred sometime in May 2020 after "an unauthorized party" obtained the personal information of some Neiman Marcus customers from their online accounts.
Google releases Chrome 94.0.4606.71 for Windows, Mac, and Linux, to fix CVE-2021-37975 and CVE-2021-37976, two zero-day vulnerabilities that have been exploited by attackers.

Author: Hydra
Description: The Hydra banking trojan is back to targeting European e-banking platform users, and more specifically, customers of Commerzbank, Germany’s second-largest financial institution.

Author: Russian-speaking threat actor
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that threat actors are trying to capitalize on the recent revelations on Pegasus spyware from Amnesty International to drop a less-known remote access tool called Sarwent.
Tags: Cisco Talos, Pegasus, Amnesty International, Sarwent

Author: GhostEmperor
Target: Southeast Asian governmental entities and telecommunication companies
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that the Chinese-speaking cyberspies from GhostEmperor have targeted Southeast Asian governmental entities and telecommunication companies for more than a year, backdooring systems running the latest Windows 10 versions with a newly discovered rootkit dubbed Demodex.

Author: Conti
Description: JVCKenwood suffers a Conti ransomware attack where the threat actors claim to have stolen 1.7 TB of data and are demanding a $7 million ransom.

Hundreds of bookstores across France, Belgium, and the Netherlands have their operations disrupted this week after a ransomware attack cripples the IT systems of TiteLive, a French company that operates a SaaS platform for book sales and inventory management.

Author: Proxy Phantom
Description: Researchers from Sift reveal the details of Proxy Phantom, a campaign using over 1.5 million sets of stolen account credentials in automated credential stuffing attacks against online merchants.

Author: ChamelGang
Target: Energy and aviation firms in Russia, and institutions including governments in nine other countries
Description: Researchers from Positive Technologies reveal the details of ChamelGang, a new threat actor targeting energy and aviation firms in Russia, and institutions including governments in nine other countries.

Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that the long-awaited release of the new James Bond movie 'No Time to Die' is being exploited by cyber-criminals via malicious pop-ups, digital adverts, and phishing websites dedicated to the new release.
Tags: Kaspersky, James Bond, No Time to Die

Description: Stonington Public Schools is hit with a ransomware attack.
Hawaii Payroll Services reveals to have suffered a ransomware attack affecting 4,500 individuals.
IT systems at National University of Ireland (NUI( Galway remain offline, after an attempted cyberattack is detected.
Tags: National University of Ireland Galway, NUI

Description: Lion Street Financial notifies about a hack of some employee email accounts that they first detected in January, 2021.

Author: Flubot
Description: New Zealand's computer emergency response team (CERT NZ) warns of a new Flubot Android malware campaign spreading via fake security updates.
Tags: New Zealand, CERT NZ, Flubot, Android

Description: The Epilepsy Foundation of Texas discloses a phishing incident that may have compromised the personal or medical information of certain individuals.

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Desorden Group claims to have breached Skynet.com.my, a  carrier company in Malaysia that provides  domestic and international carrier services.

Author: Conti
Description: Industry publication giant Sandhills Global suffers a ransomware attack, causing hosted websites to become inaccessible and disrupting their business operations.
Customers of Barclays fall victims of a series of coordinated cyberattacks by a fraudster using a Monzo account and a payments initiation service provider (PISP).
A ransomware incident cripples activities at Meliá Hotels International, one of the largest hotel chains in the world.

Author: Atom Silo
Description: Researchers from Sophos reveal a new campaign by the Atom Silo ransomware gang targeting vulnerable Confluence Server via CVE-2021-26084.
Tags: Atom Silo, ransomware, Sophos, Confluence Server, CVE-2021-26084

Author: LockBit 2.0
Description: Israeli Aerospace & Defense firm E.M.I.T. Aviation Consulting Ltd. is hit by the LockBit 2.0 ransomware.
Tags: E.M.I.T. Aviation Consulting Ltd., LockBit 2.0, ransomware

Description: Johnson Memorial Health operates under electronic health record downtime procedures, after a cyberattack hits its computer network.
The Lodi Unified School District has its internet connection cut off after a "cyber security incident".

Author: Alkhal
Description: The Data Security Council of India issues an advisory on Alkhal, a ransomware spread via spam emails, phishing and malicious URLs.
Tags: Data Security Council of India, DSCI, Alkhal

Description: A ransomware attack knocks down pages and services of the company of tourism CVC.

Author: APT41
Description: Researchers from Blackberry release a new report linking disparate malware campaigns to Chinese cyberespionage group APT41, using COVID-19 phishing lures to target victims in India.

Author: Unknown Chinese-speaking threat actor
Description: Researchers from ESET discover ESPecter, a previously undocumented real-world UEFI bootkit.
Researcher from Sophos discover a ransomware gang using a Python script to encrypt virtual machines hosted on VMware ESXi servers.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The Apache Software Foundation releases version 2.4.50 of the HTTP Web Server to address two vulnerabilities, one of which is an actively exploited.

Author: REvil AKA Sodinokibi
Description: Hong Kong marketing firm Fimmick is hit with a REvil ransomware attack.
Researchers from Cyren detect a notable increase in phishing kits designed to mimic the Chase banking portal.
Next Level Apparel, a US clothing manufacturer and e-commerce operator alerts customers to a data breach connected to the compromise of employee mailboxes.
Coughlin & Cerhart, LLP notifies to have suffered a data breach.

Author: APT28 AKA Fancy Bear
Description: Google sends out email notifications to more than 14,000 Gmail users that they’ve been the target of a spear-phishing attack orchestrated by the state-sponsored hacking group APT28

Twitch source code and streamers' and users' sensitive information are allegedly leaked online by an anonymous user on the 4chan imageboard. The leaker shares a torrent link leading to a 125GB archive containing data allegedly stolen from roughly 6,000 internal Twitch Git repositories.

Author: MalKamak (Linked to Iran?)
Target: Aerospace and Telecommunications industries in the Middle East, the U.S., Russia and Europe.
Description: Researchers from Cybereason reveal the details of Operation GhostShell, a highly-targeted cyber espionage campaign targeting the Aerospace and Telecommunications industries mainly in the Middle East, with additional victims in the U.S., Russia and Europe.

Author: FIN12
Description: A report from Mandiant reveals the details of FIN12, an aggressive, financially motivated Russian-speaking threat actor group that deploying the Ryuk ransomware via Trickbot initial access brokers, targeting the healthcare sector.

Author: Vidar
Description: Researchers at Cyberint discover a new Vidar stealer campaign abusing the Mastodon social media network to get C2 configuration without raising alarms.
Scottish multinational engineering firm Weir Group discloses an "attempted ransomware attack" that led to "significant temporary disruption" in September.

Author: Donot Team (AKA APT-C-35)
Description: Researchers from Amnesty International reveal the details of a cyber espionage campaign targeting activists in Togo via an Android spyware.
Tags: Donot Team, APT-C-35, Amnesty International, Innefu Labs

Description: ESET researchers discover FontOnLake, a previously unknown malware family that utilizes custom and well-designed modules, targeting systems running Linux.
Since at least 2016, a threat actor has hijacked TP-Link routers as part of a botnet that abused a built-in SMS capability to run an underground Messaging-as-a-Service operation

Author: LockBit
Description: French transportation giant Transdev denies that any of its information was stolen by a ransomware group after cybercriminals claimed to have 200GB of data and threatened to leak it. Instead the company believes the data referenced by the criminal group likely belongs to a client attacked on mid-September.

Author: Xgroup
Description: Researchers from DarkOwl uncover a new COVID-19 vaccination scam involving hackers tricking victims into providing their personal information under the assumption that cybercriminals can hack into European Union hospitals and falsify vaccination records.

Author: TeamTNT
Description: The Uptycs Threat Research Team identifies a campaign in which the TeamTNT threat actors deployed a malicious container image (hosted on Docker Hub) with an embedded script to download Zgrab scanner and masscanner.
Tags: Uptycs, TeamTNT, Docker Hub, Zgrab scanner, masscanner

Description: Fantasy Football Hub, a start-up specializing in Premier League fantasy football, admits it suffered a data breach after a hacker gained access to their WordPress administrator dashboard and downloaded the Hub's usernames, emails, site financial reports, and affiliate payment records.

Target: Official Facebook page of a destroyer-class Navy warship, the USS Kidd
Description: The official Facebook page of a destroyer-class Navy warship, the USS Kidd is taken over to stream Age of Empires play.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Facebook, USS Kidd, Age of Empires

Author: Vice Society
Description: Manhasset Union Free School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
Tags: Manhasset Union Free School District, ransomware, Vice Society

Author: Pysa
Description: Consolidated High School District 230 joins the list of the PYSA ransomware gang.
Tags: Consolidated High School District 230, Pysa,  ransomware

Description: JDC Healthcare Management discloses a ransomware attack occurred between July and August 2021.
Unknown hackers manage to deface Twitch for a few hours replacing a number of background game images with photos of former Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos.
Intuit warns QuickBooks customers that they are targeted by an ongoing phishing campaign impersonating the company and trying to lure potential victims with fake renewal charges.
Intuit is also being impersonated by other threat actors in a fake copyright phishing scam, delivering the Hancitor (aka Chanitor) malware downloader or Cobalt Strike beacons.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new version of a Linux crypto-mining malware previously used to target Docker containers in 2020 now focusing on Huawei Cloud.
Tags: Trend Micro, Linux, Docker, Huawei Cloud

Description: Quest Diagnostics discloses a ransomware attack occurred in August that hit ReproSource, a fertility clinic owned by the company. The ransomware attack led to a data breach, exposing a significant amount of health and financial information for about 350,000 ReproSource patients.
Oregon Eye Specialists disclose a data breach related to unauthorized activity on internal email accounts.
Plumsted Township discloses a phishing attack occurred in May.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Verizon subscribers start to receive malicious messages from unidentified senders. The phishing scam involves sending texts to a recipient through a suspicious phone number.
Students’ confidential academic files are exposed after a malicious actor obtains the username and password of  Naviance, the school's counseling platform.
A threat actor sells account databases containing an aggregate total of 34 million user records that they claim were stolen from seventeen companies during data breaches.
Tags: University of York, Oxford Brookes University, Loughborough University, University of Leeds, University of London, University of Reading, University College Oxford, Ambrose University in Alberta, Canada Human Rights Watch, Young Minds, Rhode Island School of Design in the US, University of Exeter

Author: DEV-0343
Target: US and Israeli defense technology companies
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that Iran-linked threat actors are targeting the Office 365 tenants of US and Israeli defense technology companies in extensive password spraying attacks.
Apple releases iOS 15.0.2 and iPadOS 15.0.2 to fix a zero-day vulnerability actively exploited in the wild in attacks targeting Phones and iPads.
Tags: Apple, iOS 15.0.2, iPadOS 15.0.2, Phones, iPads, CVE-2021-30883

Description: Microsoft reveals to have mitigated a record 2.4 Tbps DDoS attack targeting a European Azure customer during the last week of August.

Author: SnapMC
Description: Researchers from NCC Group reveal the details of SnapMC, a threat actor performing data exfiltration and extortion without encrypting the data.

Author: FreakOut (aka Necro, N3Cr0m0rPh)
Description: Researchers from Juniper Threat Labs discover a new version of the FreakOut botnet targeting Visual Tools DVR VX16 4.2.28.0.
Tags: Juniper Threat Labs, FreakOut, Necro, N3Cr0m0rPh,  Visual Tools DVR VX16 4.2.28.0

Description: Olympus reveals to be currently investigating a potential cybersecurity incident detected October 10, 2021 that is affecting its Americas (U.S., Canada and Latin America) IT systems.
Ecuador's largest private bank Banco Pichincha suffers a cyberattack that disrupts operations and takes the ATM and online banking portal offline

Author: IronHusky
Target: IT companies, military/defense contractors, and diplomatic entities
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of MysterySnail, a cluster of activities carried out by the Chinese threat actor IronHusky, targeting IT companies, military/defense contractors, and diplomatic entities since 2012 using a new 0-day tracked as CVE-2021-40449.
Researchers from INKY discover a phishing campaign spoofing Verizon and using mathematical symbols on impersonated company logos to evade detection.

Author: MyKings (AKA Smominru or DarkCloud)
Description: Researchers from Avast reveal that the MyKings botnet (aka Smominru or DarkCloud) is still actively spreading, making massive amounts of money in crypto, five years after it first appeared in the wild.

Author: @AnibalLeaks
Target: Argentinian RENAPER (Registro Nacional de las Personas, or National Registry of Persons)
Description: A hacker claims to have breached the Argentinian government’s IT network and stolen ID card details for the country’s entire population, data that is now being sold in private circles.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: RENAPER, Registro Nacional de las Personas, National Registry of Persons, @AnibalLeaks

Description: Visible, a US digital wireless carrier owned by Verizon, admits that some customer accounts were hacked after dealing with technical problems in the past couple of days.
Researchers from Imperva discover AllBlock, a Chromium ad blocking extension injecting hidden affiliate links that generate commissions for the developers.
The University of Sunderland in the UK announces extensive operational issues that have taken most of its IT systems down, attributing the problem to a cyber-attack.

Target: Victims in the US and EU using Tinder, Bumble, Grindr, Facebook Dating
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover CryptoRom, a dating app scam that led to the theft of millions of dollars from people on Tinder, Bumble, Grindr, Facebook Dating and similar apps.
Tags: Sophos, CryptoRom, Apple, Tinder, Bumble, Grindr, Facebook Dating

Description: The Hillel Yaffe Medical Center is hit with a ransomware attack,

Author: ITG23 AKA Wizard Spider
Description: Researchers from IBM X-Force reveal that operators behind the infamous TrickBot (ITG23 and Wizard Spider) malware have resurfaced with new distribution channels to deliver malicious payloads, such as Conti ransomware.
Tags: IBM X-Force, TrickBot, ITG23, Wizard Spider, Conti, ransomware

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign serving malicious content from TikTok via fake Among Us and Steam offerings.
The American Osteopathic Association discloses a breach affecting 27,485 individuals.
One of Brazil's largest insurance groups, Porto Seguro, reports it suffered a cyberattack that resulted in instability to its service channels and some of its systems.

Author: Desorden
Description: Acer confirms that its after-sales service systems in India were recently breached in what the company called "an isolated attack." Shortly after a threat actor leaks what it claims to be more than 60GB of files and databases from Acer's servers.

Author: Yanluowang
Description: The Symantec Threat Hunter Team uncovers what appears to be a new ransomware threat called Yanluowang that is being used in targeted attacks.

Target: California-based Water and Wastewater Systems (WWS) facility
Description: The US government reveals that malicious cyber actors used Ghost variant ransomware against a California-based WWS facility.

Target: Maine-based Water and Wastewater Systems (WWS) facility
Description: The US government reveals that malicious cyber actors used the ZuCaNo ransomware against a Maine-based WWS facility.

Target: Nevada-based Water and Wastewater Systems (WWS) facility
Description: The US government reveals that malicious cyber actors used an unknown ransomware against a Nevada-based WWS facility.

Target: New Jersey-based Water and Wastewater Systems (WWS) facility
Description: The US government reveals that malicious cyber actors used the Makop ransomware against a New Jersey-based WWS facility.

Author: TA505
Description: Researchers from Morphisec reveal a new MirrorBlast campaign targeting financial services organizations.

Author: APT35, AKA Charming Kitten
Description: Researchers from Google Threat Analysis Group reveal that suspected attackers from Iran used an array of techniques, from password theft to uploading a fake app to Google Play Store, to try gathering intelligence from targets over the past year.
Tags: Google Threat Analysis Group, APT35, Charming Kitten

Description: Researchers from Armorblox discover a vishing campaign spoofing Microsoft to try to gain remote access.

Target: Public School and Education Employee Retirement Systems of Missouri
Description: The Public School and Education Employee Retirement Systems of Missouri notifies 349,246 employees and retirees of a phishing security incident that occurred on September 11.
Tags: Public School and Education Employee Retirement Systems of Missouri

Description: Centara Hotels & Resorts reports a breach following a cyber attack.
Colleton County School District suffers a cyber incident.
An investigation is triggered after a number of cryptowallets belonging to customers of the largest NFT exchange OpenSea got mysteriously emptied.

Author: RedLine Stealer
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future reveal the details of RedLine Stealer, a malware responsible for the vast majority of stolen credentials currently sold on two dark web underground markets.
The FBI warns the US public that threat actors are actively using fake and spoofed unemployment benefit websites to harvest sensitive financial and personal information.

Author: North Korean government threat actors
Description: Twitter suspends two accounts (@lagal1990 and @shiftrows13) operated by North Korean government hackers and used as part of a plot to attract security researchers to malicious sites and infect their systems with malware.
Apollo Career Center discover that an unauthorized person had obtained access to their systems between May 5, 2021 and May 11, 2021, and had transferred some files outside of their network.
PracticeMax, a provider of billing and IT solutions to healthcare organizations, experienced a ransomware attack.

Target: Centinela Valley Union High School District
Description: Centinela Valley Union High School District discloses a ransomware incident
Tags: Centinela Valley Union High School District, ransomware

Author: BlackByte
Description: Researchers from Trustwave dicover BlackByte, a new ransomware allegedly created by Russian-speaking actors.

Author: DeepBlueMagic
Description: Ten Israeli hospitals are hit by a DeepBlueMagic ransomware attack allegedly orchestrated by Chinese hackers.
Business process outsourcing (BPO) and customer relationship management multinational Atento is hit by a cyberattack, with the greatest impact seen in Brazil, its largest operation in Latin America.

Author: Evil Corp
Description: Sinclair Broadcast Group is hit with a Macaw Locker ransomware attack.
Tags: Sinclair Broadcast Group, ransomware, Macaw Locker, Evil Corp

Author: Harvester
Target: Telecommunication providers and IT firms in South Asia
Description: Researchers from Broadcom Symantec reveal the details of Harvester, a previously unknown state-sponsored actor deploying a novel toolset in attacks targeting telecommunication providers and IT firms in South Asia.

Author: BlackMatter
Description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI), and the National Security Agency (NSA) publish a joint advisory to warn organizations of an increased threat posed by the BlackMatter ransomware gang.
Tags: Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency,  CISA, Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, National Security Agency, NSA, BlackMatter,  ransomware

Author: Lyceum APT
Target: Entities in Tunisia (telecoms or aviation companies)
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky detail a new cluster of activities from the Lyceum APT.

Author: RootAyyıldız
Description: A hacker allegedly from Turkey defaces a section of Donald Trump's website.

Professional Dental Alliance notifies tens of thousands of patients that some of their protected health information was stored in email accounts from its vendor North American Dental Management that were accessed by an unauthorized individual.
Tags: Professional Dental Alliance, North American Dental Management

Description: Ferrara Candy reveals to have been hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: LightBasin AKA UNC1945
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike reveal the details of LightBasin, a group of hackers compromising mobile telecommunication systems across the world for the past five years.

Author: PurpleFox
Description: Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new version of the PurpleFox botnet with added vulnerabilities and optimized rootkit capabilities.
Tags: Trend Micro,  PurpleFox, CVE-2020-1054, CVE-2019-0808, CVE-2019-1458,   CVE-2021-1732

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Acer suffers a second cyberattack in just a week by the same hacking group.

Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a  threat actor using political and government-themed malicious domains to target entities in India and Afghanistan via dcRAT and QuasarRAT for Windows delivered via malicious documents exploiting CVE-2017-11882.
Researchers from Avast reveal that the operators of the Magnitude exploit kit have added support for an attack chain targeting the Chrome web browser via CVE-2021-21224 and CVE-2021-31956.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Malicious actors manage to spread hundreds of malicious Squid Game apps on Google Play including a variant of the Joker malware.
Tags: Squid Game, Google Play,  Joker, Android

Author: TA505 AKA Hive0065
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign by TA505 using a new version of the FlawedGrace RAT.
The Centre for Computing History (CCH) in Cambridge, England reveals to have been hit with a phishing attack.

A group of fraudsters made off with $35 million after using forged email messages and deepfake audio to convince an employee of a United Arab Emirates company that a director requested the money as part of an acquisition of another organization,

Author: Everest
Target: Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori (SIAE)
Description: Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori (SIAE), the Italian, the agency responsible for protecting the intellectual property rights of copyright holders' creative works, is hit with an Everest ransomware attack.
Tags: Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori, SIAE,  Everest.  Ransomware

Author: Russian-speaking threat actors
Description: Researchers from Google Threat Analysis Group reveal to have blocked 1.6 million phishing emails since May 2021 that were part of a malware campaign to hijack YouTube accounts and promote cryptocurrency scams.

Author: FiveSys
Description: Researchers from Bitdefender discover FiveSys a rootkit with a Microsoft-issued digital signature used to proxy traffic to malicious destinations.
Researchers from Sonatype uncover crypto-mining malware hidden inside three JavaScript libraries, klow, klown, okhsa, uploaded on the official npm package repository.

Unknown attackers allegedly breach and infiltrate the servers of Bosch iSite, exploiting a SonarQube zero-day vulnerability, and make away with the source code of the manufacturing giant’s 5G IoT connectivity platform.

Author: Grief AKA PayOrGrief
Description: Central Indiana Orthopedics discloses to have been hit with a Grief ransomware attack.
Tags: Central Indiana Orthopedics, Grief, PayOrGrief, ransomware

Author: WizardUpdate (AKA UpdateAgent or Vigram)
Description: Microsoft says it found new variants of the macOS malware known as WizardUpdate (also tracked as UpdateAgent or Vigram), updated to use new evasion and persistence tactics.

Author: AvosLocker
Description: Three months after being hit by ransomEXX ransomware gang, the Taiwanese computer hardware manufacturer GIGABYTE falls victim to the AvosLocker ransomware.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Widespread malware campaigns are creating YouTube videos to distribute password-stealing trojans to unsuspecting viewers.
Researchers from Ahnlab discover an ongoing malware distribution campaign targeting South Korea disguising RATs as an adult game shared via webhards and torrents.

SCUF Gaming International, a leading manufacturer of custom PC and console controllers, notifies customers that its website was hacked in February to plant a malicious script used to steal their credit card information.

Author: TodayZoo
Description: Researchers from Microsoft detail TodayZoo, an unusual phishing campaign aimed at stealing passwords that uses a phishing kit built using pieces of code copied from other hackers' work.
Swiss events organizer and marketing company MCH Group was is by a malware attack.
Researchers from Check Point and RiskIQ discover multiple campaigns abusing the Discord digital communication platform to deliver malware.

Author: TA551 (AKA Shathak)
Description: Researchers from ProofPoint discover a new campaign by TA551 delivering the Sliver red-teaming tool.
Texas Lavaca Medical Center notifies 48,705 patients that their protected health data might have been exposed in a cyberattack.

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Protemps Employment Services have the personal details of some 40,000 job applicants leaked online by Desorden Group.
Hackers are selling a stolen database containing 50 million records of Moscow driver data on an underground forum for only $800.

Researchers from Huntress Lab reveal that an unknown ransomware group is exploiting a CVE-2021-42258, critical SQL injection bug in the BQE Web Suite time and billing solution to deploy ransomware on their targets' networks in ongoing attacks.
Tags: Huntress Lab, Ransomware,  CVE-2021-42258, BQE Web Suite

Description: At least eight email service providers, Runbox, Posteo, Fastmail, TheXYZ, Guerilla Mail, Mailfence, Kolab Now, and RiseUp, are hit by large distributed DDoS attacks.
Tags: Runbox, Posteo, Fastmail, TheXYZ, Guerilla Mail, Mailfence, Kolab Now, RiseUp

Description: Voipfone is hit with a DDoS attack.
The law firm Wiggin and Dana LLP discloses a ransomware attack.
Hackers hijack the popular UA-Parser-JS NPM library, with millions of downloads a week, to infect Linux and Windows devices with cryptominers and password-stealing trojans in a supply-chain attack.
UK supermarket giant Tesco restores access to its website and app after an outage strikes the service, preventing customers from ordering or cancelling deliveries.

Tech Etch, a manufacturer of precision-engineered thin metal components, flexible printed circuits, and EMI/RFI shielding, announces it was the victim of a ransomware attack in which the personal and protected health information of current and former employees was potentially compromised.
Corry School District is hit with a ransomware attack
EMI Health discloses a data breach.

Author: Groove
Description: TriValley Primary Care is hit with a Groove ransomware attack.

Author: Nobelium
Target: 140 managed service providers and cloud service provider
Description: Microsoft says the Russian-backed Nobelium threat group behind last year's SolarWinds hack is still targeting the global IT supply chain, with 140 managed service providers and cloud service providers attacked and at least 14 breached since May 2021.

Author: Devil Killer
Description: A group of Pakistani hackers defaces the website of the Sambalpur University (grievance.suniv.ac.in).
German multinational company Eberspächer Group sends a part of its factory workforce home after a ransomware attack.

Author: Ranzy Locker
Description: The FBI says that Ranzy Locker ransomware operators had compromised at least 30 US companies this year from various industry sectors.
Researchers from Avast reveal the details of UltimaSMS, a massive fraud campaign utilizing 151 Android apps with 10.5 million downloads used to subscribe users to premium subscription services.

Mozilla reveals to have blocked Bypass and Bypass XM, two malicious Firefox add-ons installed by roughly 455,000 users after discovering in early June that they were abusing the proxy API to block Firefox updates.
Agape Connecting People, a vendor that provides contact centre services and solutions, discloses a cyber attack due to unauthorised access by a malicious third party. Fullerton Health is affected.
Multiple ransomware gangs have weaponized and are abusing a zero-day in EntroLink VPN appliances after an exploit is released on an underground cybercrime forum at the start of September 2021.
An actively exploited remote code execution vulnerability in GitLab continues to affect roughly 30,000 Internet-facing installations six months after patches were released

A data breach at the University of Colorado Boulder potentially exposes the personal details of 30,000 current and former students. The incident was a result of a cyber-attack on third-party service Atlassian.
A threat actor claims to have leaked the Mercedes-Benz platform’s source code allegedly stolen from a China-based division.

Target: Specialty Surgery Center of Central New York
Description: Syracuse ASC, dba Specialty Surgery Center of Central New York, notifies 24,891 patients that some of their protected health information (PHI) was potentially accessed by unauthorized individuals who gained access to its computer systems.
Tags: Syracuse ASC, Specialty Surgery Center of Central New York

Author: Team HDP
Description: A group of hackers calling themselves Team HDP hacks into the Venezuelan intelligence body database (DGCIM) and obtains the personal details of alleged Hezbollah operatives.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Dirección General de Contrainteligencia Militar, DGCIM, Team HDP, Hezbollah

Description: The School District of Janesville says it was hit with a ransomware attack.

Target: National Iranian Oil Products Distribution Company (NIOPDC)
Description: Gas stations from the National Iranian Oil Products Distribution Company (NIOPDC) stop working due to a cyberattack that affected the entire distribution network.
Tags: National Iranian Oil Products Distribution Company, NIOPDC, Iran, Israel

Target: high-profile identities such as C-level executives
Description: The Microsoft Detection and Response Team (DART) says it detected an increase in password spray attacks targeting privileged cloud accounts and high-profile identities such as C-level executives.
Tags: Microsoft Detection and Response Team, DART

Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos discover Squirrelwaffle. a new malware tool spreading via spam campaigns and dropping multiple payloads such as Qakbot and Cobalt Strike.
Tags: Cisco Talos,  Squirrelwaffle, Qakbot, Cobalt Strike

Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of a new campaign by the Lazarus Group targeting a South Korean think tank using  new variant of the BLINDINGCAN backdoor.

Author: Lazarus Group AKA HIDDEN COBRA
Target: Company developing asset monitoring solutions in Latvia
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of a new campaign by the Lazarus Group targeting a company developing asset monitoring solutions in Latvia using  new variant of the Copperhedge backdoor.
Tags: Kaspersky,  Lazarus Group, HIDDEN COBRA, Copperhedge

Description: Researchers at Qihoo 360 discover an ongoing Android spyware campaign targeting Israeli users since 2018.
Schreiber Foods is hit with a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Abnormal Security discover a new phishing campaign attempting to collect Microsoft 365 credentials using QR codes.

Researchers from INKY discover a new phishing campaign in which threat actors manipulate Craigslist email system to send fraudulent violation notifications, spreading malware hosted on an abused OneDrive page that impersonates major brands like DocuSign, Norton, and Microsoft.
Tags: INKY, Craigslist,  OneDrive,  DocuSign, Norton, Microsoft

Description: Community Medical Centers notifies 656,047 patients of a ransomware incident.
Seneca Family of Agencies reveals to have been identified unauthorized activity within its computer systems.

Author: Desorden Group
Description: Central Restaurants Group are the latest victim of the Desorden Group
Samaritan Daytop Village discloses a security incident.

Author: Grief AKA PayOrGrief
Description: The Grief ransomware gang claims to have attacked the National Rifle Association (NRA) and releases stolen data as proof of the attack.
Tags: Grief, PayOrGrief, ransomware,  National Rifle Association, NRA

Description: Hackers steal an estimated $130 million worth of cryptocurrency assets from Cream Finance, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform.

Author: TA2722 AKA Balikbayan Foxes
Target: Shipping, logistics, manufacturing, pharmaceutical, business, and energy sectors across the US, Europe, and Asia.
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new threat group impersonating the Philippine government and businesses and targeting the shipping, logistics, manufacturing, pharmaceutical, business, and energy sectors across the US, Europe, and Asia with the Remcos and Nanocore trojans.
Tags: TA2722, Balikbayan Foxes, Proofpoint,  Philippines, Remcos,  Nanocore

Author: Wslink
Target: Organizations in in Central Europe, North America, and the Middle East
Description: Researchers from ESET discover Wslink, a previously undescribed loader for Windows binaries that runs as a server and executes modules in memory.
Researchers from Bot Sentinel uncover a ‘coordinated campaign’ against Harry and Meghan on Twitter.
Some of the keys used to generate the European Green Pass are stolen and distributed in the underground to create false COVID-19 health certificates.
A retired couple in Florida loses all their savings using a scam via the payment app Venmo.

Target: Washington Central Unified Union School District
Description: Washington Central Unified Union School District discloses a possible ransomware attack.
Tags: Washington Central Unified Union School District

Author: HelloKitty (AKA FiveHands)
Description: The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation FBI sends out a flash alert warning private industry partners that the HelloKitty ransomware gang (aka FiveHands) has added distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks to their arsenal of extortion tactics.

Author: Chaos
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a variant of the Chaos ransomware that appears to target Minecraft gamers in Japan.

Author: Snake
Description: Researchers from Cybereason reveal the details of Snake, a popular password-stealing trojan sold for as low as $25 in popular dark web forums.
Google releases Chrome 95.0.4638.69 for Windows, Mac, and Linux to fix two zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2021-38000 and CVE-2021-38003) actively exploited.

Author: FakeCop
Description: A new variant of the Android info-stealer FakeCop is discovered in phishing campaigns impersonating  KDDI and masquerading as 'Anshin Security,' a popular antivirus product in Japan.

Author: AbstractEmu
Description: Researchers at Lookout identify AbstractEmu, a new Android rooting malware distributed on Google Play and other App stores via 19 applications with more than 10,000 downloads.

Description: Researchers from Menlo Security discover GootLoader, a campaign distributing the REvil ransomware via SEO poisoning abusing compromised WordPress sites.

Description: Researchers from Menlo Security discover a campaign distributing the SolarMarker backdoor via SEO poisoning abusing compromised WordPress sites.
Tags: Menlo Security,  SolarMarker, SEO poisoning,  WordPress

Author: TA575
Target: All industries primarily in the United States

Researchers from Fortinet discover a new scam using the lure of an Amazon gift card generator to steal cryptocurrency from people.
Security researchers at Lookout discover  AbstractEmu, a new Android malware strain that contains the ability to root smartphones.
UMass Memorial Health notifies 200,individuals that someone hacked into its employee email system, potentially exposing their personal information.
A ransomware attack on Papua New Guinea's finance ministry briefly disrupts government payments and operations.

Description: Researchers from Rapid7 identify a malware campaign targeting Windows 10 via a technique able to bypass Windows protections called User Account Control (UAC).

Description: Nationwide Laboratory Services reveals to have been hit with a ransomware attack affecting 33,000 individuals.
The City of Titusville provides notice of a phishing incident that may have affected the security of personal information pertaining to certain individuals.

Description: Researchers from Group-IB uncover a large networks of fake shops, phishing websites disguised as card shops, targeting relatively new entrants in the space.

Author: BlackShadow
Description: The BlackShadow hacking group attacked the Israeli hosting provider Cyberserve to steal client databases and disrupt the company's services.

Author: Hive
Description: Researchers from ESET discover a new Hive ransomware variant, able to encrypt Linux and FreeBSD.

Author: Pink
Description: Researchers from Qihoo 360’s Netlab discover a huge botnet, tracked as Pink, that already infected over 1.6 million devices to launch DDoS attacks and to insert advertisements in the legitimate HTTP traffic of the victims, most of which are in China (96%).
Throckmorten County Memorial Hospital discovers a malware incident compromising the personal information of 3,136 employees and patients..

Description: Martin County Tax Collector is hit with a BlackByte ransomware attack.

Description: Sea Mar Community Health Centers provides notice of a data security incident
Strategic Benefits Advisors discloses to have been hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: Conti
Description: The Conti ransomware gang hits the high society jeweler Graff and threatens to release private details of world leaders, actors and tycoons.

Target: Regional health systems in the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador
Description: The regional health systems in the Canadian province of Newfoundland and Labrador are taken down by a ransomware attack. The outage affects health systems in Central Health, Eastern Health, Western Health, and the Labrador-Grenfell Regional Health authorities.
Tags: Newfoundland and Labrador,  ransomware,  Central Health, Eastern Health, Western Health, Labrador-Grenfell Regional Health

Description: The Toronto Transit Commission (TTC), which runs the city's public transportation system, reports a ransomware attack
Professional Healthcare Management discloses ransomware incident

Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that a legitimate Amazon Simple Email Service (SES) token issued to a third-party contractor was recently used by threat actors behind a spear-phishing campaign targeting Office 365 users.
Tags: Kaspersky, Amazon Simple Email Service, SES, Microsoft 365

Description: Google releases the Android November 2021 security updates, which address 18 vulnerabilities including CVE-2021-1048, under limited, targeted exploitation.

Author: Foreign intelligence agency
Description: Chinese officials say that a foreign intelligence agency hacked several of its airlines in 2020 and stole passenger travel records.

Author: Government of Nicaragua and the Sandinista National Liberation Front (FSLN) party.
Description: Facebook announces that it shut down a "troll farm" allegedly run by the government of Nicaragua and the Sandinista National Liberation Front (FSLN) party.
Tags: Facebook, Nicaragua, Sandinista National Liberation Front, FSLN

Description: A cyber attack temporarily shuts down the computer system and website of the Toledo Lucas County Public Library
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Massachusetts Interscholastic Athletic Association is defaced.
Tags: netsaosa, g0retrance, MIAA, Massachusetts Interscholastic Athletic Association

Author: Pysa
Description: Las Vegas Cancer Center is hit with a Pysa ransomware attack.
Tags: Las Vegas Cancer Center, Pysa, ransomware

Description: Urban Resource Institute discloses a phishing attack.
The personal data of 1,355 National University of Singapore Society (NUSS) members are stolen after the society's website is hacked.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover  an active phishing campaign promoting via Discord and targeting Steam gamers.
The National Bank of Pakistan suffers a destructive data-wiping attack.
Viverant PT reveals that the personally identifiable information (PII) of current and former patients and employees was affected in a breach after the email of an employee was compromised.

Author: Lockean
Description: Researchers from France’s Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) reveal the details of Lockean, a ransomware affiliate group targeting French companies.
The UK Labour Party notifies members that some of their information was impacted in a data breach after a ransomware attack hit a supplier managing the party's data.

Author: Mekotio
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new campaign of the Mekotio banking trojan targeting multiple countries in South America

Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of Tortilla, a new threat actor hacking Microsoft Exchange servers and breaching corporate networks using the ProxyShell vulnerability to deploy the Babuk Ransomware.

Author: MasterFred
Target: Android users from Poland and Turkey
Description: A new Android malware known as MasterFred uses fake login overlays to steal the credit card information of Netflix, Instagram, and Twitter users.

Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a new Magecart group that uses a browser script to evade detection and the execution in virtualized environments.
Desert Pain Institute reveals a data security incident that may have resulted in unauthorized access to the sensitive personal information of some former and current patients and employees.
Danaos Management Consultants is hit with a ransomware attack that impacts multiple Greek shipping companies.
JEV Plastic Surgery & Medical Aesthetics  discloses a malware incident.
Domaining.com is compromised.
Prairie Lakes Healthcare System notifies patients that unauthorized activity disrupted its network.
Family of Woodstock discloses to have suffered a cyber attack compromising the protected health information of 8,214 individuals.
Lakeside School breach reveals a data security incident.

Author: Avos Locker
Description: Beaverhead County High School is hit by an Avos Locker ransomware attack.

Description: Threat actors are exploiting a security flaw in GitLab self-hosted servers (CVE-2021-22205) to assemble botnets and launch gigantic distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks, with some in excess of 1 terabit per second.
US defense contractor Electronic Warfare Associates (EWA) discloses a data breach after threat actors hacked their email system and stole files containing personal information.

Researchers from Check Point discover a campaign using advertisements in Google Search to promote fake cryptocurrency wallets and DEX platforms to steal user's cryptocurrency and able to steal $500,000 worth in few days.
The popular npm library 'coa' is hijacked  with malicious code injected into it.
Even the npm library 'rc configuration loader' is hijacked  with malicious code injected into it.

Author: MirCop
Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a new phishing campaign pretending to come from a supplier and infecting the users with the MirCop ransomware.
South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport confirms that mySA Gov accounts were compromised through a cyber attack.
Researchers from Armorblox discover a phishing campaign impersonating the cybersecurity firm Proofpoint to trick victims into providing Microsoft Office 365 and Gmail credentials.
Researchers from Avanan discover a new campaign spoofing a typical Amazon order confirmation.
Maxim Healthcare discloses a phishing attack.
Jukin Media is hacked and has its data dumped.
Kearsarge Regional School District discloses a data security incident.
Costco Wholesale Corporation warns customers that their payment card information might have been stolen while recently shopping at one of its stores after a credit card skimmer was discovered.

Author: Iranian Threat Actor
Description: BlueNoroff, a North Korean threat actor steaks an estimated $55 million worth of cryptocurrency assets from bZx, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform that allows users to borrow, loan, and speculate on cryptocurrency price variations.

Author: RootAyyıldız
Description: The FBI's Cyber Division reveals that ransomware gangs have hit several tribal-owned casinos, taking down their systems and disabling connected systems.
The Australian Cyber Security Center (ACSC) alerts web admins of the active exploitation of CVE-2021-42237, a remote code execution flaw in the Sitecore Experience Platform (Sitecore XP).

Author: Zebra2104
Target: A number of companies in Australia and Turkey
Description: A report from BlackBerry uncover an initial access broker called "Zebra2104" that has connections to three malicious cybercriminal groups (MountLocker, Phobos and the StrongPity APT) cybercriminal groups.
The Urology Center of Colorado (“TUCC”) announces a data incident that may have impacted individuals’ information.

Author: Snatch
Description: QRS suffers a Snatch a ransomware attack.

Description: New York Psychotherapy and Counseling Center reveals that a computer server in their offices had been accessed by an unauthorized third-party.

Description: Researchers from Metabase Q discover three campaigns distributing the Dridex malware in Mexico.

Description: Victory Health Partners discloses to have been hit by a ransomware attack.

Description: Stock trading platform Robinhood discloses a data breach after their systems were hacked and a threat actor gained access to the personal information of approximately 7 million customers.

Author: Hive
Description: Electronics retail giant MediaMarkt  suffers a Hive ransomware attack with an initial ransom demand of $240 million, causing IT systems to shut down and store operations to be disrupted in Netherlands and Germany.

Description: Microsoft warns to immediately patch CVE-2021-42321, a high severity Exchange Server vulnerability that may allow authenticated attackers to execute code remotely on vulnerable servers.

Author: Lyceum AKA Hexane, Siamesekitten, or Spirlin
Target: ISPs and telecommunication operators in Israel, Morocco, Tunisia, and Saudi Arabia as well as a ministry of foreign affairs (MFA) in Africa.

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Target: Twitter users in the Central African Republic
Description: Twitter removes a network of 16 accounts linked to the IRA that attempted an information operation in the Central African Republic.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Twitter, IRA Internet Research Agency, Central African Republic, Russia

Author: IRA (Internet Research Agency)
Description: Twitter removes a network of  50 accounts that attacked the civilian Libyan government and actors that support it, while voicing significant support for Russia’s geopolitical position in Libya and Syria.
Tags: Twitter, IRA Internet Research Agency, Libya, Syria, Russia

Author: Tanzania
Description: Twitter removes a network of 268 accounts utilized to file bad faith reports on Twitter, targeting members and supporters of FichuaTanzania and its founder.

Author: Uganda
Description: Twitter removes a network of 418 accounts engaged in coordinated inauthentic activity in support of Ugandan presidential incumbent Museveni and his party, National Resistance Movement (NRM).
Tags: Twitter, Museveni, National Resistance Movement, NRM.

Author: Venezuela
Description: Twitter removes network of 277 Venezuelan accounts that amplified accounts, hashtags, and topics in support of the government and its official narratives via an app called Twitter Patria.

Author: Cuba
Target: At least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.
Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) reveals that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised the networks of at least 49 organizations from US critical infrastructure sectors.
Tags: Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, Cuba,  ransomware

Description: Resarchers from Mailguard discover a persuasive and ongoing series of phishing attacks use fake Office 365 notifications asking the recipients to review blocked spam messages to steal their Microsoft credentials.
Hackers steal an estimated $120 million worth of Bitcoin and Ether assets from Badger, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform.

Author: Magnat
Target: Victims in Canada, the United States, Europe, Australia and Nigeria.
Description: Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal the details of Magnat, a campaign distributing fake versions of popular software to trick users into downloading three forms of malware.

Author: Tor2Mine
Description: Researchers from Sophos discover a new variant of the Tor2Mine miner using a PowerShell script that attempts to disable malware protection, execute a miner payload and harvest Windows credentials

Author: Cuba
Target: At least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S
Description: The FBI warns that the Cuba ransomware gang has compromised at least 49 entities in five critical sectors in the U.S. as of November.

Target: Members of the United States military and their families
Description: Researchers at Lookout identify a phishing campaign targeting members of the United States military and their families.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Business software provider Zoho urges customers to update their Desktop Central and Desktop Central MSP installations to the latest available version after a critical vulnerability (tracked as CVE-2021-44515) is exploited in the wild.
Tags: Zoho, Desktop Central, Desktop Central MSP, CVE-2021-44515

Target: At least nine U.S. State Department employees
Description: The iPhones of at least nine U.S. State Department employees were hacked by an unknown assailant using the spyware developed by the Israel-based NSO Pegasus.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: BRATA
Description: Researchers from Cleafy discover a campaign in Italy exploiting the  BRATA Android remote access trojan (RAT), with threat actors calling victims of SMS attacks to steal their online banking credentials.
Accountancy firm Bansley and Kiener LLP announces it was the victim of a December 2020 ransomware attack.
Tags: firm Bansley and Kiener LLP, ransomware

Description: Riverhead Central School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
Ulss 6 Euganea (a local national health unit) is hit with a cyber attack.
At least 18 fake birth certificates are generated in Hisar, after the Health Department is hacked.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Cryptocurrency exchange reveals that it was hacked for $150 million.
Researchers from Red Canary reveal that threat actors are distributing altered KMSpico installers to infect Windows devices with malware that steals cryptocurrency wallets.
A new phishing campaign has been targeting verified Twitter accounts

Author: RedLine
Description: Cybercriminals are spamming website contact forms and discussion forums to distribute Excel XLL files that download and install the RedLine password and information-stealing malware.
Approximately 330 SPAR shops in northern England face severe operational problems following a weekend cyberattack, forcing many stores to close or switch to cash-only payments.
A cyberattack takes Maryland’s health department offline.

Author: Nobelium
Description: Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the Nobelium hacking group continues to breach government and enterprise networks worldwide by targeting their cloud and managed service providers and using a new custom "Ceeloader" malware.

Author: Nobelium
Description: The French national cyber-security agency ANSSI (Agence Nationale de la Sécurité des Systèmes d'Information)says that the Russian-backed Nobelium hacking group has been targeting French organizations since February 2021.
Tags: ANSSI, Agence Nationale de la Sécurité des Systèmes d'Information, Nobelium

Author: Nickel (AKA KE3CHANG, APT15, Vixen Panda, Royal APT, and Playful Dragon)
Description: Microsoft seizes dozens of malicious sites used by the Nickel China-based hacking group to target organizations in the US and 28 other countries worldwide.
Tags: Microsoft, Nickel, KE3CHANG, APT15, Vixen Panda, Royal APT, Playful Dragon

Author: Conti
Description: Nordic Choice Hotels confirms a cyber attack on its systems from the Conti ransomware group.
Researchers from Sucuri reveal that threat actors are injecting credit card swipers into random plugins of e-commerce WordPress sites.

Author: Moobot
Description: Researchers from Fortinet reveal that a Mirai-based botnet called 'Moobot' is spreading aggressively via exploiting a critical command injection flaw in the webserver of many Hikvision products.

Researchers from Gemini Advisory reveal that threat actors have abused a legitimate feature of the Google Tag Manager service to secretly add and deploy malicious JavaScript code to more than 300 e-commerce stores since March this year.

Author: HelloKitty
Description: The Oregon Anesthesiology Group (OAG) said it suffered a ransomware attack in July that led to the breach of the personal information of 750,000 patients and 522 current and former OAG employees.
Tags: Oregon Anesthesiology Group, OAG, HelloKitty, Ransomware

Author: Glupteba
Description: Google announces that it has taken action to disrupt the Glupteba botnet that controls more than 1 million Windows PCs around the world, growing by thousands of new infected devices each day.
QNAP warns customers today of ongoing attacks targeting their NAS devices with a cryptomining malware (oom_reaper), urging them to take measures to protect them immediately.

Author: Cerber
Description: The Cerber ransomware is back, as a new ransomware family with the old name, and targets Atlassian Confluence and GitLab servers using remote code execution vulnerabilities (respectively CVE-2021-26084 and CVE-2021-22205 for Confluence and GitLab)

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that US universities are being targeted in multiple phishing attacks, using COVID-19 Omicron lures, designed to impersonate college login portals to steal valuable Office 365 credentials.
Tags: Proofpoint, US universities, Office 365, COVID-19, Omicron

Author: XE Group
Description: Researchers from Volexity reveal the details of XE Group, a Vietnamese-origin criminal threat actor linked to eight years of for-profit hacking and credit card skimming.

Author: Emotet
Description: The Emotet malware starts to install Cobalt Strike beacons directly, giving immediate network access to threat actors and facilitating ransomware attacks.
Sound Generations announces that unauthorized individuals have gained access to its internal systems and have used ransomware to encrypt files in two separate attacks.
Saltzer Health reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
Boulder Neurosurgical and Spine Associates reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.

Target: Region IV Area Agency on Aging
Description: Region IV Area Agency on Aging reveals to have suffered a phishing attack.
Tags: Region IV Area Agency on Aging

Description: Scammers are using fake job listings from multiple game studios including Riot Games to empty the wallets of young, hopeful victims looking to break into the gaming industry.
Pellissippi State Community College discloses a ransomware attack.
Eldon School District is hit with a ransomware attack.

Author: Dark Mirai
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover that the botnet known as Dark Mirai (AKA MANGA, Dark.IoT) is exploiting a new vulnerability on the TP-Link TL-WR840N EU V5, a popular inexpensive home router released in 2017.
Tags: Fortinet, Dark Mirai, MANGA, Dark.IoT, TP-Link, TL-WR840N EU V5, CVE-2021-4165

Description: Researchers from jFrog discover 17 additional malicious npm packages caught stealing Discord tokens and environment variables.

Author: TAG-16
Target: Several high-profile military and government organizations across Southeast Asia
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future’s Insikt Group reveal the details of TAG-16, a Chinese state-sponsored group which has compromised several high-profile military and government organizations across Southeast Asia throughout 2021 using custom malware families such as FunnyDream and Chinoxy
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, TAG-16,  FunnyDream,  Chinoxy, China

Author: Suspected Chinese state-sponsored
Description: Researchers from Recorded Future’s Insikt Group discover a campaign carried out by a Chinese state-sponsored group targeting entities in Laos including the Cambodia’s Sihanoukville Autonomous Port (PAS).
Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Cambodia, China, Sihanoukville Autonomous Port, PAS

Author: Suspected Chinese state-sponsored
