Tags: Recorded Future, Insikt Group, Laos, China, National Committee for Special Economic Zones, SEZs,  National Enterprise Database, NED

Description: North American food importer Atalanta admits that it suffered a data breach involving employees’ personal information as the result of a ransomware attack.
Valley Mountain Regional Center  notifies 17,197 patients that some of their protected health information was stored in email accounts that were accessed by unauthorized individuals.

Author: StrongPity AKA APT-C-41 and PROMETHIUM
Description: Researchers from Minerva Labs reveal the details of the latest campaign of the StrongPity APT using a malicious version of the popular Notepad++ application.
Tags: Minerva Labs,  StrongPity, APT-C-41, PROMETHIUM Notepad++

Author: ALPHV AKA BlackCat
Description: Security researchers discover a new ransomware written in Rust

Researchers from Wordfence detect a massive wave of attacks in the last couple of days, originating from 16,000 IPs and targeting over 1.6 million WordPress sites, targeting four WordPress plugins (PublishPress Capabilities, Kiwi Social Plugin, Pinterest Automatic, WordPress Automatic) and fifteen Epsilon Framework themes
Tags: Wordfence. WordPress, PublishPress Capabilities, Kiwi Social Plugin, Pinterest Automatic, WordPress Automatic, Epsilon Framework

Description: Researchers from Cofense discover a new phishing campaign targeting German e-banking users, involving QR codes in the credential-snatching process.
Researchers from Avanan discover a phishing campaign taking advantage of the Outlook productivity features to make the spoofed message more credible.
Oahu Transit Services, a transport operator in Hawaii is hit with a possible ransomware attack.
The Municipality of Nowiny is hit with a ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Author: Snatch
Description: Swedish carmaker Volvo Cars discloses that attackers have stolen research and development information after hacking some of its servers.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Threat actors start to massively scan vulnerable Apache Log4j servers after a severe vulnerability is disclosed.

Author: Karakurt
Description: Researchers from Accenture reveal the details of Karakurt, a financially motivated threat actor, primarily using VPN credentials to gain initial access to a victim's network.

Author: Conti
Description: The Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) says Conti ransomware attacks have targeted multiple Australian organizations from various industry verticals.
Tags: Conti, Ransomware, Australian Cyber Security Centre, ACSC

Author: Agent Tesla
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the Agent Tesla malware distributed in an ongoing phishing campaign that relies on Microsoft PowerPoint documents laced with malicious macro code.

Author: RansomEXX
Description: German logistics provider Hellmann Worldwide Logistics is hit with a ransomware attack.

Description: The Brazil's Ministry of Health (MoH) suffers a ransomware attack, losing 50Tb of data including COVID/19 vaccination data.

Description: Texas ENT Specialists announces it was the victim of a ransomware that was detected on October 19, 2021.

Description: BioPlus Specialty Pharmacy Services, LLC notifies patients of a recent data security incident that may have involved their information.

Description: The Python Package Index (PyPI) registry removes three malicious Python packages (aws-login0tool, dpp-client, dpp-client1234) aimed at exfiltrating environment variables and dropping trojans on the infected machines. The malicious packages are estimated to have generated over 10,000 downloads
Tags: Python Package Index, PyPI, aws-login0tool, dpp-client, dpp-client1234

Description: Crypto platform AscendEX suffers an estimated $77.7 million worth loss after being hit by cyber attack.
Southern Orthopaedic Associates (SOA) notifies 106,910 patients about a breach of some of their protected health information.

Description: Workforce management solutions provider UKG discloses to have suffered a ransomware attack.

Author: TinyNuke
Target: Corporate addresses and individuals working in manufacturing, technology, construction, and business services in France
Description: Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign distributing the info-stealing malware TinyNuke, and targeting French users with invoice-themed lures.
Google releases Chrome 96.0.4664.110 for Windows, Mac, and Linux, to address a high-severity zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Target: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Twitter account

Target: Servers in Malaysia, Mongolia, Indonesia, and the Philippines.

ONUS, one of the largest Vietnamese crypto trading platforms, suffers a cyber attack on its payment system running a vulnerable Log4j version. The threat actors approached ONUS to extort a $5 million sum.
Capital Region Medical Center (CRMC) confirms it was the victim of a cyber attack.
Weddell Pediatric Dental Specialists notifies 5,356 individuals that an unauthorized individual gained access to an employee’s email account that contained their protected health information.
Duneland School Corporation notifies employees and dependents of a data breach.
The German Pharmacists’ Association (DAV) is the target of a phishing attack aimed to falsify vaccination data.
A threat actor sells account databases containing an aggregate total of 34 million user records that they claim were stolen from seventeen companies during data breaches.
Tags: University of York, Oxford Brookes University, Loughborough University, University of Leeds, University of London, University of Reading, University College Oxford, Ambrose University in Alberta, Canada Human Rights Watch, Young Minds, Rhode Island School of Design in the US, University of Exeter

Description: A threat actor sells account databases containing an aggregate total of 34 million user records that they claim were stolen from seventeen companies during data breaches.
Tags: University of York, Oxford Brookes University, Loughborough University, University of Leeds, University of London, University of Reading, University College Oxford, Ambrose University in Alberta, Canada Human Rights Watch, Young Minds, Rhode Island School of Design in the US, University of Exeter

Author: eCh0raix AKA QNAPCrypt
Description: Users of QNAP NAS devices report attacks on their systems with the eCh0raix ransomware, also known as QNAPCrypt.
Several malicious campaigns are abusing the Microsoft Build Engine (MSBuild) to execute a Cobalt Strike payload on compromised systems.
Tags: Microsoft Build Engine, MSBuild, Cobalt Strike

Description: Florida Digestive Health Specialists LLP notifies more than 212,500 individuals of a December 2020 breach involving business email compromise and fraud.

Author: BlackTech
Description: Researchers from NTT Security detect the BlackTech cyber-espionage APT group targeting Japanese companies using a novel malware that researchers call ‘Flagpro’.
T-Mobile confirms that recent reports of a new data breach are linked to notifications sent to a "very small number of customers" who fell victim to SIM swap attacks.
Many LastPass users report that their master passwords have been compromised after receiving email warnings that someone tried to use them to log into their accounts from unknown locations.
Amedia, the largest local news publisher in Norway, announces that several of its central computer systems were shut down in what it is calling an apparent “serious” cyberattack.

Researchers from Amnpardaz, an Iranian security company, discover iLOBleed, a rootkit that hides inside the firmware of HP iLO devices and which has been used in real-world attacks to wipe servers of Iranian organizations.

Author: AQUATIC PANDA
Description: Researchers from Crowdstrike reveal that the threat actor dubbed AQUATIC PANDA is trying to exploit the Log4Shell  CVE 2021-44228 vulnerability.
Brown County confirms a malware security breach occurred on August 2021.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority (SLGA) reports that it has temporarily disabled certain computer systems and applications, as it investigates a cybersecurity incident that occurred on Dec. 25.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Saskatchewan Liquor and Gaming Authority, SLGA

Author: Avos Locker
Description: The Avos Locker ransomware operation provides a free decryptor after learning they encrypted a US government agency.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Researchers from Aquasec reveal the details of a cryptomining campaign targeting misconfigured Docker APIs and able to avoid detection since 2019.
Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Police is hit by an apparent cyberattack and data is put up for sale on the internet.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Crawford County Assessor’s Office is hit by a cyberattack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Donnelley & Sons, a vendor of NJ Office of Information Technology suffers a cyber attack and all the activity is affected.
U.S. online store PulseTV discloses a large-scale customer credit card compromise with more than 200,000 shoppers impacted.
The Gloucester City Council suffers a cyber attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: The Broward Health public health system discloses a large-scale data breach incident impacting 1,357,879 individuals.

Author: NightSky
Description: NightSky is the first new ransomware discovered in 2022.
A transparency activist shares information indicating a massive trove of data stolen from the Chattanooga Area Chamber of Commerce by a ransomware gang is up for sale.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Chattanooga Area Chamber of Commerce, ransomware

Author: Lapsus$
Description: The Lapsus$ ransomware gang hacks and extorts Impresa, the largest media conglomerate in Portugal and the owner of SIC and Expresso, the country’s largest TV channel and weekly newspaper, respectively.

Author: China or Russia?
Target: Defence Academy of the United Kingdom
Description: A retired military officer discloses a cyberattack that struck the UK Ministry of Defence (MoD) academy (Defence Academy of the United Kingdom) and had a "significant" impact on the organization.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Defence Academy of the United Kingdom, UK Ministry of Defence, MoD, China, Russia

Description: Researchers from Minerva Labs discover a malicious Telegram for Desktop installer distributing the Purple Fox malware to install further malicious payloads on infected devices.
Researchers from Palo Alto discover a campaign where the attackers compromised a cloud video hosting service to inject a web skimmer in over 100 real estate sites.

Ravkoo, a US Internet-based pharmacy service, discloses a data breach after the company's AWS hosted cloud prescription portal is involved in a security incident that may have led to personal and health information being accessed.

Author: APT37 (AKA StarCruft, Group123, Operation Erebus, and Operation Daybreak).
Description: Researchers from Cluster25 reveal that APT37 have compromised the email account of a staff member of Russia’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MID) and deployed spear-phishing attacks against the country’s diplomats in other regions via the Konni malware.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: APT37, StarCruft, Group123, Operation Erebus, Operation Daybreak, Cluster25, Konni, Russia’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, MID

Author: BlackCat AKA ALPHV
Description: Italian luxury fashion giant Moncler confirms to have been hit with a AlphV/BlackCat ransomware attack.
The website of the English-language Jerusalem Post media outlet is defaced in the anniversary of the killing of Qasem Soleimani.
The Twitter account of Hebrew-language Maariv media outlet is defaced in the anniversary of the killing of Qasem Soleimani.

Target: Twitter account of the Indian Medical Association
Description: The official Twitter accounts of the Indian Medical Association is compromised in a series of crypto hacks.

Target: Twitter account of the Indian Council of World Affairs
Description: The official Twitter accounts of the Indian Council of World Affairs is compromised in a series of crypto hacks

Target: Twitter account of the Mann Deshi Bank
Description: The official Twitter accounts of the Mann Deshi Bank is compromised in a series of crypto hacks.
Signature Healthcare announces a data breach that has affected 9,798 Brockton Hospital patients. Suspicious activity was detected in its email environment on November 4, 2021
Peachtree Orthopaedic Clinic discloses an unauthorized access.
The cracked passwords for almost 7.5 million DatPiff members are being sold online.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: The FBI sends out an alert warning users of Google Voice phishing.

Target: Illinois Office of the Special Deputy Receiver (OSD)
Description: The Illinois Office of the Special Deputy Receiver confirms to have been hit by a cyberattack, resulting in $6.85 millions of dollars in losses to two auto insurance agencies under liquidation
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Illinois Office of the Special Deputy Receiver, OSD

Author: MalSmoke
Description: Researchers from Check Point discover a new Zloader campaign exploiting Microsoft's digital signature verification, via a modified installer of Atera, to deploy malware payloads and steal user credentials from thousands of victims from 111 countries.

Author: Elephant Beetle
Target: Businesses in the financial sector in Latin America
Description: Researchers from Sygnia reveal the details of 'Elephant Beetle', a financially-motivated threat actor focused in businesses in the financial sector in Latin America.

Target: 17 well-known companies, including online retailers, restaurant chains, and food delivery services
Description: The New York State Office of the Attorney General (NY OAG) warns 17 well-known companies that roughly 1.1 million of their customers have had their user accounts compromised in credential stuffing attacks.
Tags: New York State Office of the Attorney General, NY OAG

Author: Unknown threat group
Description: The UK's National Health Service (NHS) publishes a cyber alert warning of an unknown threat group targeting VMware Horizon deployments with Log4Shell exploits.
Tags: UK's National Health Service, NHS, VMware Horizon, Log4Shell, CVE-2021-44228

Description: County government buildings and public offices are closed across the cities of Albuquerque, Los Ranchos, and Tijeras after a ransomware attack cripples the IT network of the Bernalillo County government.
Tags: Albuquerque, Los Ranchos, Tijeras. Ransomware, Bernalillo County

Description: Specialty chemicals company Element Solutions reveals that it had experienced a cybersecurity incident.
Capital Region Medical Center discloses to have suffered a cyber attack whose restore operations are still in progress.

Author: Uawrongteam
Description: Accounts of more than three million users of the U.S.-based FlexBooker appointment scheduling service have been stolen in an attack before the holidays and are now being traded on hacker forums.
Researchers from Avanan discover multiple campaigns leveraging the comment feature in Google Docs, targeting primarily Outlook users, to distribute phishing pages and malware.
FinalSite, a leading school website services provider, suffers a ransomware attack disrupting access to websites for thousands of schools worldwide.

Author: FluBot
Description: Researchers from F5 discover additional FluBot campaigns targeting more European countries.

Author: Sfile AKA Escal
Description: The operators of the SFile ransomware, also known as Escal, have ported their malware to work and encrypt files on Linux-based operating systems.
Fertility Centers of Illinois (FCI) notifies 79,943 current and former patients that some of their protected health information may have been viewed or obtained by unauthorized individuals.
Jefferson Surgical Clinic notifies 174,769 individuals about a June, 2021 data breach
Advent Health Partners discloses a phishing incident.
The OG Department Store discloses a breach of customers’ personal data due to a breach to a third-party.

Author: FIN7
Description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) warns US companies that the financially motivated FIN7 cybercriminal group targeted the US defense industry with packages containing malicious USB devices (BadUSB) to deploy the BlackMatter or REvil ransomware.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: \Federal Bureau of Investigation, FBI, FIN7, USB, ransomware, BlackMatter, Revil, BadUSB

Author: Patchwork APT (AKA Dropping Elephant, Chinastrats, or Quilted Tiger)
Description: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal the details of the latest campaign of the Patchwork APT actors using malicious RTF documents impersonating Pakistani authorities to infect targets with a new variant of the BADNEWS RAT, known as Ragnatela.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Malwarebytes, Patchwork APT, Dropping Elephant, Chinastrats, Quilted Tiger BADNEWS RAT, Ragnatela

Description: QNAP warns customers to secure Internet-exposed network-attached storage (NAS) devices immediately from ongoing ransomware and brute-force attacks.

Grass Valley announces an extensive data breach involving the Social Security numbers and more of all city employees and vendors -- as well as anyone who had their information given to the local police department.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Reports emerge about an alleged massive data leak of Indonesian hospital patients’ medical information being sold in an illegal internet forum. The attackers claim to have breached the Indonesian Health Ministry to obtain the data.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Description: Compton and Broomhead Dental Center is hit by threat actors who dump the stolen files.
Monroe Public Schools notify a ransomware attack.
An individual advertises access to TLO, a data tool by TransUnion typically used by private investigators to obtain sensitive information on targets
Suncoast Skin Solutions starts notifying 57,730 patients about a ransomware attack that was discovered on July 14, 2021.

Hackers are targeting cybersecurity researchers and developers in a sophisticated malware campaign distributing a malicious version of the dnSpy .NET application to install cryptocurrency stealers, remote access trojans, and miners.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Threat actors from Vice Society dump data from Carthage R-9 district.
Tags: Carthage R-9 district, ransomware, Vice Society

Description: Threat actors who use data-sharing website Doxbin have passwords, decryptor keys, multi-factor authentication codes and stealer logs leaked online.

Author: Lockbit 2.0
Description: MCS Morandi is hit by Lockbit 2.0

Author: Avos Locker
Description: AvosLocker is the latest ransomware gang adding support for encrypting Linux systems to its recent malware variants, specifically targeting VMware ESXi virtual machines.

Author: NightSky
Description: Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the NightSky ransomware gang is starting to exploit the critical CVE-2021-44228 Log4Shell vulnerability to gain access to VMware Horizon systems.
Tags: Microsoft, NightSky, ransomware, CVE-2021-44228, Log4Shell, VMware Horizon

Author: RedLine
Description: Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the RedLine info-stealer distributed via emails using a fake COVID-19 Omicron stat counter app as a lure.

Loyola University Medical Center (LUMC) notifies 16,934 patients that some of their PHI has been exposed and potentially accessed by an unauthorized individual who gained access to an employee email account.
About 39 million purported patient records from Siriraj Hospital are offered for sale on an internet database-sharing forum.
Lympo, a sports' NFT platform, suffers a breach that lost the company close to $19 million in its native LMT token.

Target: National Association of Community Health Centers
Description: National Association of Community Health Centers discloses a ransomware attack.
Tags: National Association of Community Health Centers

Author: SysJoker
Description: Researchers from Intezer discover a new multi-platform backdoor malware named 'SysJoker' targeting Windows, Linux, and macOS with the ability to evade detection on all three operating systems.

Author: APT35 (aka Charming Kitten, TA453, or Phosphorus)
Description: Researchers from Check Point reveal that the Iranian APT35 state-backed group has been observed leveraging Log4Shell attacks to drop a new PowerShell backdoor called CharmPower.
Tags: APT35, Charming Kitten, TA453, Phosphorus, Log4Shell, PowerShell, CharmPower

Description: Electronic Arts (EA) discloses that hackers used social engineering against EA’s customer experience team to bypass two-factor authentication and take over 50 FIFA 22 accounts.

Author: Multiple Russian state-sponsored threat actors
Target: Local and tribal governments in the US
Description: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) releases an alert detailing a variety of tactics used by Russian state-sponsored groups to attack local and tribal governments across the US between September 2020 and December 2020.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security
Tags: Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, CISA, Russia

Description: The health information management services provider CIOX Health suffers a data breach due to a phishing attack that has affected at least 32 healthcare providers.

Author: ShinyHunters
Description: ShinyHunters claim to have hacked Aditya Birla Group, a major Indian fashion retailer and starts to leak the data.
Neenah schools are hit by an apparent cyber attack.

Author: Vice Society
Description: Hospital Centro de Andalucia discloses a Vice Society ransomware attack.
Tags: Hospital Centro de Andalucia, Vice Society, Ransomware

Author: Lapsus$
Description: The Brazilian car rental firm Localiza is hit with a Lapsus$ ransomware attack.

Author: OceanLotus AKA APT32, SeaLotus and Cobalt Kitty
Description: Researchers from Netskope discover a campaign by the OceanLotus group of state-sponsored hackers, using the web archive file format (.MHT and .MHTML) to deploy backdoors to compromised systems.
Tags: Netskope, OceanLotus, APT32, SeaLotus., Cobalt Kitty

Author: Magniber
Description: Researchers from AhnLab discover a new campaign distributing the Magniber ransomware in disguise of a fake Chrome and Firefox updates via Windows application package files (.APPX) signed with valid certificates.

Author: Lorenz
Description: Hensoldt, a multinational defense contractor headquartered in Germany, confirms that some of its UK subsidiary's systems were compromised in a Lorenz ransomware attack.

Author: Vice Society
Description: The web site of Argentina’s senate (Senado Argentina) is hit with a Vice Society ransomware attack.
Target Class: Public admin and defence, social security

Target: 35 journalists and activists from El Salvador
Description: Citizen Lab reveals that the smartphones of dozens of journalists and activists from El Salvador have been hacked with a version of the Pegasus spyware.
The Albuquerque Public Schools system is hit with a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new campaign leveraging public cloud infrastructure, deploying the Nanocore, Netwire, and AsyncRAT payloads.
OneDigital, an insurance broker, discloses a ransomware attack.

Author: BlueNoroff
Description: Researchers from Kaspersky discover SnatchCrypto, the latest campaign of the North Korean threat actor group known as 'BlueNoroff' targeting cryptocurrency startups with malicious documents and fake MetaMask browser extensions.

Author: Multiple threat actors
Description: Researchers from Avanan discover multiple campaigns where phishers are creating Adobe Creative Cloud accounts and using them to send phishing emails capable of thwarting traditional checks.

Author: GootLoader
Description: Researchers from eSentire, warn law and accounting firms of a wide-spread GootLoader campaign.
